questions.question: ………………………… standing at the gate, I saw something strange.
questions.description: While can be used to talk about two simultaneous actions or situations.

questions.question: I know a shop ……………………….. they repair old watches.
This is the park …………………………. we used to meet.
The man ………………………… mother was seriously ill urged the doctors to save her life.
questions.description: The relative pronoun whose indicates possession.

questions.question: ………………………… it was an old town, we couldn’t find any good accommodation.
She is ………………………….. old to walk without support.
…………………… her good performance, she was denied promotion.
questions.description: In spite of is a preposition use it before a noun or noun phrase.

questions.question: ………………………….. she is very old, she is still very much on her own.
questions.description: Though is used to connect two contrasting ideas.

questions.question: …………………….. did she get the message, than she started for home.
………………………… he was the most deserving candidate, he had no difficulty getting the job.
You can stay with me ……………………………….. you take care of your expenses.
He asked a question ............................ no one could answer.
